title: Grant-Kohrs Ranch National Historic Site: Partners
body: Partners          Glacier National Park Conservancy  The result of a merger between The Glacier National Park Fund and the Glacier Association, the Glacier National Park Conservancy helps to support Grant-Kohrs Ranch's educational, interpretive, cultural, and scientific programming needs with aid generated by bookstore sales.  For more information regarding this important partner, please visit the Glacier National Park Conservancy website at glacierconservancy.org.     Â        Grant-Kohrs Ranch Foundation '...is to provide resources to Grant-Kohrs Ranch National Historic Site to tell the cattle ranching story of the American West.' The Grant-Kohrs Ranch Foundation was formed to encourage those who appreciate "America's Ranch," to help the National Park Service maintain high quality public services and ranch care.  Currently, the Foundation is building an endowment fun and supporting key park projects with funds raised from individual and private donations.  These wholly independent 501(c)3 donations are granted back to the park to achieve excellence in public programs and innovation in resource management.  The ten member board meets 3-4 times annually on the ranch and is comprised of local, state, and national leaders.  For more information, visit the Grant-Kohrs Ranch Foundation website or contact Marshall Gingery, President of the Board, GKRF, P.O. Box 789, Deer Lodge, Montana, 59722. Make a donation through the Grant-Kohrs Ranch Foundation.
